title: Understanding the Accounting Number Format
text: The Accounting Number Format is used to display numbers as currency, aligning the currency symbols and decimal points in a column.

title: Understanding the Comma Style Format
text: The Comma Style Format is used to display numbers with thousand separators, making large numbers easier to read.

hintAnswer: Under the Home tab in the Number group
title: Locating the Number Group
text: Where can you find the Accounting Number Format and Comma Style buttons in Excel?
choices: Under the Home tab in the Number group
Under the Insert tab in the Chart group
Under the Data tab in the Sort & Filter group

title: Applying the Formats
text: What is the first step to apply the Accounting Number Format and Comma Style?

hintAnswer: Click the 'Accounting Number Format' and 'Comma Style' buttons under the Home tab and Number group
title: Finalizing the Format Application
text: After selecting the desired range, what should you do next?
choices: Click the 'Accounting Number Format' and 'Comma Style' buttons under the Home tab and Number group
Type in numbers to cells, Excel will apply this automatically
